'Abiel Abbot Low' (February 7, 1811 â January 7, 1893) was an American
entrepreneur, businessman, trader and philanthropist who gained most of his
fortune from the China trade, importing teas, porcelains, and silk, and building
and operating a fleet of reputable clipper ships.
